channel.title: BBC News - Entertainment & Arts

item.title: Britney Spears investigated over dispute with employee
item.description: A member of staff says the singer struck her, while Ms Spears' lawyer says no-one was injured.

item.title: Cinema box office takings at 50% of pre-pandemic levels
item.description: Box office takings in the past month are half of their pre-pandemic levels.

item.title: Clive Myrie: Becoming Mastermind host is a big, big job
item.description: The journalist may be feeling jittery about his new role but hopes it will reveal his lighter side.

item.title: Aaliyah albums streaming: 'Her influence is absolutely everywhere'
item.description: Her second album, One In A Million, is streaming for the first time, 20 years after her death.

item.title: Lizzo: Facebook and Instagram remove abusive comments from singer's accounts
item.description: The US singer spoke earlier this week about receiving "hurtful" attacks on social media.

item.title: Changing Rooms: Makeover TV show is back - what did critics think?
item.description: Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen and his leather trousers usher the home makeover show back after 17 years.

item.title: Nicole Kidman reportedly enters Hong Kong quarantine-free
item.description: Hong Kong media say the Australian star was seen out and about in the city two days after arriving.

item.title: Censor: Video nasty film explores the power of horror
item.description: The film Censor, set during the 80s, delves into impact of the lurid horror movies from that era.

item.title: R. Kelly trial: Singer 'knew I was underage', accuser tells court
item.description: The US R&B singer is accused of sexual abuse, racketeering and bribery; charges which he has denied.

item.title: Nubya Garcia: The British sax star who is jazzing up the BBC Proms
item.description: Saxophonist Nubya Garcia on playing Royal Albert Hall, the Mercury Prize and "natural vibrations".

item.title: Lady Leshurr: Rapper used lockdown to focus on mental health
item.description: The 32-year-old says life sometimes feels like a running machine at the gym with no stop button.

item.title: Banksy: A guide to his 'Great British Spraycation'
item.description: New murals that have appeared on England's east coast are confirmed as the work of the elusive artist.

item.title: Noel Gallagher: Photographer captures Oasis star's years on tour
item.description: Sharon Latham travelled the world with Noel Gallagher after she joked about photographing his band.

item.title: Shetland’s biggest gig – the day Pulp flew in to Lerwick
item.description: At the height of their fame, the Britpop icons travelled to Lerwick to play a show for just 1,400 fans.

item.title: Drag Race UK queens on battles with Brexit and Covid
item.description: The latest British series features its first ever female drag queen, and a familiar face.

item.title: You may go to the ball: Cinderella opens in the West End
item.description: Andrew Lloyd Webber and Emerald Fennel’s reimagining of the classic fairytale debuts in London.

item.title: Bill Bailey pays tribute to ‘dearest friend’ Sean Lock
item.description: The comedian remembers Sean Lock, who has died from cancer at the age of 58.

item.title: Bill Murray: Golf-loving Ghostbusters star given hand-forged putter
item.description: When the comedy star needed a new putter, who was he gonna call? A County Antrim blacksmith of course.

item.title: Brandon Flowers on new Killers album Pressure Machine, inspired by Utah hometown
item.description: The Killers frontman speaks about their new album, Pressure Machine, inspired by his rural hometown.

item.title: 'I make art out of discarded face masks'
item.description: Thomas Yates posts artwork he's created out of used face masks on social media.
